meanings.definition: The perpetual, inalienable possession of land by a corporation or other legal entity.
meanings.sent1: The church held the land in mortmain for centuries, never able to sell or transfer it.
meanings.sent2: The concept of mortmain was established to prevent organizations from hoarding land indefinitely.
meanings.sent3: The idea of mortmain seemed like a never-ending game of hot potato for the legal team.
meanings.sent4: The mortmain of the property by the company felt like a heavy weight on their balance sheet.
meanings.sent5: The mortmain of the land by the government was as unyielding as a mountain.
